 19718                                  
 19719                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19720                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19721                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19722                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19723                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19724                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19725                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19726                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19727                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19728                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19729                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19730                                  ;
 19731                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19732                                  
 19733                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19734                                  update_arena:
 19735 00000974 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19736 00000975 57                      	push	di
 19737 00000976 51                      	push	cx
 19738 00000977 52                      	push	dx
 19739                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19740                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19741                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19742                                  	; ds = cs 
 19743 00000978 C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19744 0000097C 4F                      	dec	di
 19745 0000097D 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19746                                  						;  before sysvar
 19747 0000097E 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19748                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19749 00000980 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19750 00000985 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19751 00000987 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19752                                  
 19753                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19754 00000989 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19755 0000098E 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19756 00000990 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19757 00000992 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19758 00000994 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19759                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19760 00000996 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19761                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19762 0000099A C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19763 000009A0 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19764                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19765 000009A2 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19766 000009A6 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19767                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19768                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19769 000009A8 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19770 000009AB 5A                      	pop	dx
 19771 000009AC 59                      	pop	cx
 19772 000009AD 5F                      	pop	di
 19773 000009AE 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19774 000009AF C3                      	retn
 19775                                  ;
 19776                                  ; M012 : END
 19777                                  ;
 19778                                  FatalErr:

 19784                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"

 19794                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19795                                  ;
 19796                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19797                                  ;
 19798                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19799                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19800                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19801                                  ;
 19802                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19803                                  ;
 19804                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19805                                  
 19806                                  AllocHMA:
 19807                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19808                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19809                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19810                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19811                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19812                                  
 19813                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19814                                  ;
 19815                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19816                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19817                                  ;	push	ax
 19818                                  ;	popf
 19819                                  ;	pushf
 19820                                  ;	pop	ax
 19821                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19822                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19823                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19824                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19825                                  
 19826                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19827                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19828                                  
 19829 000009BB 1E                      	push	ds
 19830                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19831                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19832                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19833 000009BC B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19834 000009BF 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19835                                  
 19836 000009C1 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19837 000009C4 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19838                                  
 19839 000009C6 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19840 000009C9 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19841                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19842                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19843                                  
 19844 000009CB 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19845                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19846 000009CF 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19847                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19848                                  
 19849 000009D3 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19850 000009D5 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19851                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19852 000009D8 FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19853 000009DC 48                      	dec	ax
 19854 000009DD 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19855                                  
 19856                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19857                                  
 19858 000009DF B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19859 000009E1 CD15                    	int	15h
 19860                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19861                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19862                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19863 000009E3 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19864                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19865                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19866 000009E6 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19867                                  allocHMA_1:
 19868 000009E8 B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19869                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19870 000009EA FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19871 000009EE 48                      	dec	ax
 19872 000009EF 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19873                                  
 19874 000009F1 E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19875 000009F4 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19876                                  
 19877 000009F6 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19878 000009F9 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19879 000009FB 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19880 00000A02 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19881                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19882                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19883 00000A09 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19884                                  
 19885                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19886                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19887                                  ;	; cf=0
 19888                                  ;	;clc
 19889                                  ;	pop	ds
 19890                                  ;	retn
 19891                                  
 19892                                  grabhma_error:
 19893 00000A0B F9                      	stc
 19894                                  	; 11/12/022
 19895                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19896                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19897 00000A0C 1F                      	pop	ds
 19898 00000A0D C3                      	retn

 19900                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19901                                  ;
 19902                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 19903                                  ;
 19904                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 19905                                  ;
 19906                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 19907                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 19908                                  ;
 19909                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19910                                  
 19911                                  IsXMSLoaded:
 19912 00000A0E B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h

 19914                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 19915                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver
 19916 00000A13 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h		; XMS installed?
 19917 00000A15 C3                      	retn

 19957 00000A2D 5E                      	pop	si
 19958 00000A2E 5A                      	pop	dx
 19959 00000A2F 59                      	pop	cx
 19960 00000A30 5B                      	pop	bx
 19961 00000A31 58                      	pop	ax
 19962                                  
 19963 00000A32 CB                      	retf
 19964                                  
 19965                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19966                                  ;
 19967                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19968                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19969                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19970                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19971                                  ;
 19972                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19973                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19974                                  ;
 19975                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19976                                  
 19977                                  StartVDHead:
 19978                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19979                                  
 19980 00000A33 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19981 00000A37 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19982 00000A39 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19983 00000A3B 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19984 00000A3D 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19985                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19986 00000A3E 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19987                                  VDiskSig1:
 19988 00000A45 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19989                                  
 19990                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19991                                  
 19992 00000A4A 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19993                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19994 00000A50 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19995 00000A5F 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19996 00000A61 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19997                                  VDInt19:
 19998 00000A62 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19999                                  OldVDInt19:
 20000 00000A63 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20001                                  
 20002                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20003                                  
 20004                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20005 00000A67 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20006                                  VDiskSig2:
 20007 00000A6A 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20008                                  
 20009                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20010                                  
 20011 00000A6F 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20012 00000A72 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20013 00000A74 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20014 00000A75 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20015 00000A77 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20016 00000A78 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20017 00000A7A 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20018 00000A7C FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20019 00000A7D 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20020 00000A7F 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20021 00000A81 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20022 00000A83 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20023 00000A85 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20024                                  
 20025                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 20026                                  
 20027                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20028                                  ;
 20029                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20030                                  ;
 20031                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20032                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20033                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20034                                  ;
 20035                                  ; Inputs : None
 20036                                  ;
 20037                                  ; Outputs : None
 20038                                  ;
 20039                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20040                                  ;
 20041                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20042                                  
 20043                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20044                                  
 20045                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20046 00000A87 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20047 00000A89 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20048                                  
 20049                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20050                                  
 20051                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20052 00000A8B A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20053                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20054 00000A8E 2EA3[630A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20055 00000A92 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20056                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20057 00000A95 2EA3[650A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20058                                  
 20059                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20060                                  
 20061 00000A99 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20062                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20063                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20064 00000A9B BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20065 00000A9E CD21                    	int	21h
 20066                                  
 20067                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20068                                  
 20069 00000AA0 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20070 00000AA1 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20071                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20072 00000AA3 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20073                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20074 00000AAA 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20075 00000AB1 40                      	inc	ax
 20076 00000AB2 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20077                                  
 20078                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20079                                  
 20080 00000AB4 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20081                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20082 00000AB5 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20083 00000ABB A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20084                                  
 20085                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20086                                  
 20087                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20088 00000ABE B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20089 00000AC1 BE[330A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20090 00000AC4 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20091 00000AC6 0E                      	push	cs
 20092 00000AC7 1F                      	pop	ds
 20093 00000AC8 FC                      	cld
 20094 00000AC9 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20095 00000ACB FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20096                                  
 20097                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20098                                  
 20099                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20100 00000ACC 57                      	push	di
 20101 00000ACD 06                      	push	es
 20102                                  
 20103                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20104                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20105                                  	; 04/09/2023
 20106 00000ACE 49                      	dec	cx
 20107                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20108 00000ACF 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20109                                  
 20110 00000AD1 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20111                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20112 00000AD4 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20113 00000AD7 BE[670A]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20114 00000ADA F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20115                                  
 20116 00000ADC 5F                      	pop	di
 20117 00000ADD 07                      	pop	es
 20118                                  
 20119 00000ADE C3                      	retn
 20120                                  
 20121                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20122                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 20123                                  ;
 20124                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 20125                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 20126                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 20127                                  ;
 20128                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20129                                  
 20130                                  struc desc
 20131 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 20132 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 20133 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 20134 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 20135 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 20136                                   .size:
 20137                                  endstruc
 20138                                  
 20139                                  		; 23/10/2022
 20140                                  bmove:		;label byte
 20141                                  
 20142                                  dummy:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20143 00000ADF 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0		 
 20144                                  gdt:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20145 00000AE7 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20146 00000AEF FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 20147 00000AF1 0000                    		dw	0
 20148 00000AF3 00                      		db	0
 20149 00000AF4 93                      		db	93h
 20150 00000AF5 0000                    		dw	0
 20151 00000AF7 FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB
 20152 00000AF9 0000                    		dw	0
 20153 00000AFB 10                      		db	10h
 20154 00000AFC 93                      		db	93h
 20155 00000AFD 0000                    		dw	0
 20156                                  
 20157                                  rombios_code:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20158 00000AFF 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20159                                  temp_stack:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 20160 00000B07 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20161                                  
 20162 00000B0F 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 20163                                  
 20164                                  
 20165                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIt1.ASM)
 20166                                  
 20167                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20168                                  
 20169                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20170                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20171                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20172                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20173                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20174                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20175                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20176                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20177                                  ;								      ;I070
 20178                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20179                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20180                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20181                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20182                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20183                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20184                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20185                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20186                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20187                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20188                                  ;								      ;I070
 20189                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20190                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20191                                  
 20192                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20193                                  	; ds = cs
 20194                                  
 20195 00000B2F 06                      	push	es
 20196 00000B30 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20197 00000B32 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20198 00000B34 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20199 00000B36 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20200 00000B38 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20201 00000B3A D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20202 00000B3C 05[0F0B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20203 00000B3F 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20204                                  
 20205                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20206                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20207                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20208                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20209                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20210                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20211                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20212 00000B42 A3[F10A]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 20213                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20214 00000B45 8816[F30A]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20215                                  
 20216 00000B49 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 20217 00000B4C 0E                      	push	cs
 20218 00000B4D 07                      	pop	es
 20219 00000B4E BE[DF0A]                	mov	si,bmove
 20220 00000B51 B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 20221 00000B53 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 20222                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 20223                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 20224                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 20225 00000B55 07                      	pop	es

 20259                                  	;

 20270 00000B77 1F                      	pop	ds

 20384                                  ;	chuckst -- answer: no. Confbot is used to access the CDSs,
 20385                                  ;	25 jul 92  which are stored BELOW it. Alloclim is the
 20386                                  ;		   variable which has the top of free memory for
 20387                                  ;		   device driver loads, etc.
 20388                                  
 20389 00000BD8 29C6                    	sub	si,ax
 20390

 20392                                  ;		that automatically updates alloclim every time we
 20393                                  ;		set up some new CDSs. Instead, I've added code

 20396                                  ;		we place MagicDrv.sys

 21232                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21233                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21234                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21235                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21236                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21237                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21238                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21239                                  ;
 21240                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21241                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21242                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21243                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21244                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21245                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21246                                  ;
 21247                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21248                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21249                                  ;
 21250                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21251                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21252                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21253                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21254                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21255                                  ;
 21256                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21257                                  ;
 21258                                  ;			  none.
 21259                                  
 21260                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21261                                  ;
 21262                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21263                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21264                                  
 21265                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21266                                  
 21267 00000F32 50                      	push	ax

 21269 00000F34 52                      	push	dx

 21272 00000F36 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port

 21469                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21470                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21471                                  ;
 21472                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21473                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21474                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21475                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21476                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed

 21488                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21489                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21490                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21491                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21492                                  ; carridge return.

 21615                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21616                                  
 21617                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21618                                  ;
 21619                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21620                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21621                                  ;
 21622                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21623                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21624                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21625                                  
 21626                                  ParaRound:
 21627 0000109A 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21628 0000109D D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21629 0000109F D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21630 000010A1 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21631 000010A3 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21632 000010A5 C3                      	retn
 21633                                  
 21634                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21635                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21636                                  ;
 21637                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21638                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21639                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21640                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21641                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21642                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21643                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21644                                  ;
 21645                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21646                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21647                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21648                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21649                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21650                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21651                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21652                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21653                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21654                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21655                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21656                                  ;
 21657                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21658                                  
 21659                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21660                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21661                                  sysinit_base:				
 21662 000010A6 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21663 000010AB 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21664 000010B0 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21665 000010B2 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21666 000010B7 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21667 000010BC 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21668 000010BD 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21669 000010BE 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21670                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21671                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21672 000010C0 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21673 000010C3 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21674 000010C8 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21675                                  
 21676                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21677                                  
 21678 000010CA B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21679 000010CC 0E                      	push	cs
 21680 000010CD 1F                      	pop	ds
 21681 000010CE BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21682 000010D1 CD21                    	int	21h
 21683                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21684                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21685                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21686                                  _stall: 
 21687                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21688 000010D3 F4                      	hlt 
 21689                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21690                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21691 000010D4 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21692                                  
 21693                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21694 000010D6 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21695                                  
 21696                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21697                                  
 21698                                  sum_up:
 21699                                  
 21700                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21701                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21702                                  ;
 21703                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21704                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21705                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21706                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21707                                  ;
 21708                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21709                                  
 21710 000010DB 1E                      	push	ds
 21711                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21712                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21713 000010DC 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21714 000010E0 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21715 000010E2 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21716 000010E4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21717 000010E6 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21718                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21719 000010EB D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21720 000010ED 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21721                                  sum1:
 21722 000010EF 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21723 000010F1 46                      	inc	si
 21724 000010F2 46                      	inc	si
 21725 000010F3 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21726                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21727                                  sum_sys_code:
 21728                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21729 000010F5 BEF410                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21730                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21731                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21732                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21733                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21734                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21735                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21736                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21737 000010F8 B9[F037]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21738 000010FB 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21739 000010FD D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21740                                  sum2:
 21741 000010FF 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21742 00001102 46                      	inc	si
 21743 00001103 46                      	inc	si
 21744 00001104 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21745 00001106 1F                      	pop	ds
 21746 00001107 C3                      	retn
 21747                                  
 21748                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21749

 21769                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21770                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21771                                  ;
 21772                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21773                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21774                                  ;
 21775                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21776                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21777                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21778                                  ;
 21779                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21780                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21781                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21782                                  
 21783                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21784                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21785                                  
 21786                                  set_buffer:
 21787 00001127 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21788 00001129 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21789 0000112C 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21790                                  	;mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21791                                  	; 17/09/2023
 21792 0000112E FEC2                    	inc	dl ; mov dl,1
 21793                                  set_buff_1:
 21794                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21795                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21796 00001130 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21797                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21798 00001132 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21799                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21800 00001135 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21801                                  
 21802 0000113A 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21803 0000113C 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21804 00001141 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21805                                  
 21806                                  ;	for each buffer
 21807                                  
 21808                                  nxt_buff:
 21809 00001142 E86100                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 21810 00001145 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 21811 00001147 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21812                                  
 21813 00001149 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 21814                                  
 21815 0000114E 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 21816                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21817 0000114F 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21818 00001152 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21819                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21820                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21821 00001154 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 21822                                  
 21823 00001158 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMA ?
 21824 0000115A 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 21825                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 21826 0000115C C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 21827 00001160 2EA1[E003]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 21828                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0
 21829 00001164 C7470D0000              	mov	word [bx+13],0
 21830                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff+2],ax
 21831 00001169 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax
 21832 0000116C 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; size of scratch buff
 21833                                  	;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 21834 00001170 83E814                  	sub	ax,20
 21835                                  set_buff_2:
 21836 00001173 2E0106[DE03]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 21837                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 21838 00001178 2E800E[0614]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 21839                                  	;call	round
 21840                                  	;retn
 21841                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21842 0000117E E98C1E                  	jmp	round
 21843                                  
 21844                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21845                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21846                                  ;
 21847                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21848                                  ;
 21849                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21850                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 21851                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21852                                  
 21853                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21854                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21855 00001181 53                      	push	bx
 21856 00001182 52                      	push	dx
 21857 00001183 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 21858 00001187 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 21859                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 21860 0000118C 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 21861                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21862                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 21863                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21864 0000118F 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 21865 00001191 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 21866 00001193 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 21867                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 21868 00001196 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 21869 00001198 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 21870 0000119B 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 21871                                  
 21872                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 21873                                  	; 05/09/2023
 21874                                  	; zf=1
 21875 0000119D 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 21876                                  	; zf=1
 21877                                  
 21878                                  	;zf=1
 21879                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 21880                                  	;zf=1
 21881 0000119E 2E8E06[E003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 21882                                  got_hma:
 21883 000011A3 5A                      	pop	dx
 21884 000011A4 5B                      	pop	bx
 21885 000011A5 C3                      	retn
 21886

 21889                                  set_buffer_info:
 21890                                  
 21891                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector

 21895                                  ;
 21896                                  ;out:
 21897                                  ;    above entries set.
 21898                                  
 21899                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21900 000011A6 2EFF36[3903]            	push	word [cs:buf_prev_off]
 21901                                  	;pop	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev]
 21902 000011AB 268F4502                	pop	word [es:di+2]
 21903 000011AF 2EA3[3903]              	mov	[cs:buf_prev_off],ax
 21904 000011B3 2E0306[9B02]            	add	ax,[cs:singlebuffersize]	;adjust ax
 21905                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 21906 000011B8 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 21907                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 21908 000011BB 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 21909                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21910 000011C1 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 21911                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 21912 000011C7 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 21913 000011CD C3                      	retn

 21915                                  ; ======================================================================
 21916                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21917                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21918                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21919                                  
 21920                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21921                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21922                                  ;
 21923                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21924                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21925                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21926                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21927                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21928                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21929                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21930                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21931                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21932                                  ;
 21933                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21934                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21935                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21936                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21937                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21938                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21939                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21940                                  ;	conditions:
 21941                                  ;
 21942                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21943                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21944                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21945                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21946                                  ;
 21947                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21948                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21949                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21950                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21951                                  ;
 21952                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21953                                  ;
 21954                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21955                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21956                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21957                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21958                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21959                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21960                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21961                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21962                                  ;
 21963                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21964                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21965                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21966                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21967                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21968                                  ;
 21969                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21970                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21971                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21972                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21973                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21974                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21975                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21976                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21977                                  ;
 21978                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21979                                  
 21980                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21981                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21982                                  
 21983                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21984                                  stackinit:
 21985 000011CE 50                      	push	ax
 21986 000011CF 1E                      	push	ds
 21987 000011D0 06                      	push	es
 21988 000011D1 53                      	push	bx
 21989 000011D2 51                      	push	cx
 21990 000011D3 52                      	push	dx
 21991 000011D4 57                      	push	di
 21992 000011D5 56                      	push	si
 21993 000011D6 55                      	push	bp
 21994                                  
 21995                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21996                                  
 21997                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21998                                  	; ds = cs
 21999 000011D7 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22000 000011DA 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22001                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22002                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22003                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22004 000011DC 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22005                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22006 000011E0 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs

 22008                                  	; 12/12/2022

 22018                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)

 22020 000011F3 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22021

 22023

 22044

 22049 00001219 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22050 0000121B 06                      	push	es
 22051 0000121C 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22052                                  
 22053                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22054

 22062                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space

 22803 000013B0 750B                    	jne	short int_xx_not_first
 22804                                  
 22805 000013B2 06                      	push	es
 22806                                  	;push	dx
 22807                                  	;mov	dx,0F000h
 22808 000013B3 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 22809 000013B5 263B1E01FF              	cmp	bx,[es:0FF01h]
 22810                                        	;pop	dx
 22811 000013BA 07                      	pop	es
 22812 000013BB 7401                    	je	short int_xx_first
 22813                                  
 22814                                  int_xx_not_first:
 22815 000013BD F9                      	stc
 22816                                  int_xx_first:
 22817 000013BE 1F                      	pop	ds
 22818 000013BF C3                      	retn
 22819                                  
 22820                                  ;%endif
 22821                                  
 22822                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22823                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22824                                  
 22825                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22826                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22827                                  
 22828                                  new_init_loop:
 22829                                  
 22830                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22831                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22832                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22833                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22834                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22835                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22836                                  
 22837 000013C0 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22838 000013C3 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22839 000013C5 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22840 000013C9 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22841                                  
 22842 000013CC 1E                      	push	ds
 22843                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22844                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22845                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22846 000013CD B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22847 000013D0 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22848 000013D2 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22849 000013D5 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22850 000013D7 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22851 000013DB 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 22852 000013DE 1F                      	pop	ds
 22853                                  
 22854 000013DF 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22855 000013E2 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22856 000013E6 C3                      	retn
 22857                                  
 22858                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22859                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22860                                  
 22861                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22862                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22863                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22864                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22865                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22866                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22867                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22868                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22869                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22870                                  
 22871                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22872                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22873                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22874                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 22875                                  
 22876                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 22877                                  
 22878                                  setdevmark:
 22879                                  
 22880                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22881                                  	;push	es
 22882                                  	;push	cx
 22883                                  
 22884 000013E7 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22885 000013EC 2E890E[0414]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22886 000013F1 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22887                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22888                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22889 000013F3 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22890 000013F7 41                      	inc	cx
 22891                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22892 000013F8 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22893                                  
 22894                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22895                                  	;pop	cx
 22896                                  	;pop	es
 22897                                  	
 22898 000013FD 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22899 00001402 C3                      	retn

 23099                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23100                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23101                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23102                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23103                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23104                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23105                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23106                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS

 23108                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23109                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23110                                  
 23111                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23112                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23113 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX

 23115 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23116                                  endstruc
