 23136                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23137                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23138 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23139 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23140 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23141                                  endstruc
 23142                                  
 23143                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23144                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23145                                  ;
 23146                                  ;
 23147                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23148                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23149                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23150                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23151                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23152                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23153                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23154                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23155                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23156                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23157                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23158                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23159                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23160                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23161                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23162                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23163                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23164                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23165                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23166                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23167                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23168                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23169                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23170                                  ;	   :
 23171                                  ;
 23172                                  ;Note:
 23173                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23174                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23175                                  ;
 23176                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23177                                  ;
 23178                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23179                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23180                                  ;
 23181                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23182                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23183                                  ;
 23184                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23185                                  ;
 23186                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23187                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23188                                  ;
 23189                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23190                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23191                                  ;
 23192                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23193                                  ;
 23194                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23195                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23196                                  ;
 23197                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23198                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23199                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23200                                  ;
 23201                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23202                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23203                                  ;
 23204                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23205                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23206                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23207                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23208                                  
 23209                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23210                                  
 23211                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23212                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23213                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23214                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23215                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23216                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23217                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23218                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23219                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23220                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23221                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23222                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23223                                  
 23224                                  ;**** Function flags
 23225                                  
 23226                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23227                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23228                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23229                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23230                                  
 23231                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23232                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23233 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23234 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23235 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23236 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23237 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23238 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23239                                  endstruc
 23240                                  
 23241                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23242                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23243                                  ;
 23244                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23245                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23246                                  ;	     +-
 23247                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23248                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23249                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23250                                  ;	     |	:
 23251                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23252                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23253                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23254                                  ;	     |	:
 23255                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23256                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23257                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23258                                  ;	     +-	:
 23259                                  ;
 23260                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23261                                  ;
 23262                                  ;Note:
 23263                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23264                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23265                                  ;
 23266                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23267                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23268                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23269                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23270                                  
 23271                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23272                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23273                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23274                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23275                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23276                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23277                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23278                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23279                                  
 23280                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23281 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23282 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23283 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23284 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23285 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23286                                  endstruc
 23287                                  
 23288                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23289                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23290                                  ;
 23291                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23292                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23293                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23294                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23295                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23296                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23297                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23298                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23299                                  ;
 23300                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23301                                  ;
 23302                                  ;            +-
 23303                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23304                                  ;	    | or
 23305                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23306                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23307                                  ;	    | or
 23308                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23309                                  ;	    | or
 23310                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23311                                  ;	    | or
 23312                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23313                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23314                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23315                                  ;	    | or
 23316                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23317                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23318                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23319                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23320                                  ;	    +-
 23321                                  ;
 23322                                  ;
 23323                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23324                                  ;      list.
 23325                                  ;
 23326                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23327                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23328                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23329                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23330                                  
 23331                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure

 23334 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23335 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23336 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23337                                  endstruc

 23367                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23368                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23452                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23453                                  ; SysParse;
 23454                                  ;
 23455                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23456                                  ;
 23457                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23458                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23459                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23460                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23461                                  ;
 23462                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23463                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23464                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23465                                  ;
 23466                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23467                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23468                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23469                                  ;
 23470                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23471                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23472                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23473                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23474                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23475                                  ;
 23476                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23477                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23478                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23479                                  ;
 23480                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23481                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23482                                  ;
 23483                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23484                                  ;
 23485                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23486                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23487                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23488                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23489                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23490                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23491                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23492                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23493                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23494                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23495                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23496                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23497                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23498                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23499                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23500                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23501                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23502                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23503                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23504                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23505                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23506                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23507                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23508                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23509                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23510                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23511                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23512                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23513                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23514                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23515                                  
 23516                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23517                                  
 23518                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23519                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23520                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23521                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23522                                  
 23523                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23524                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23525                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23526                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23527                                  ;
 23528                                  
 23529                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23530                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23531                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23532                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23533                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23534                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23535                                  
 23536                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23537                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23538                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23539                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23540                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23541                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23542                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23543                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23544                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23545                                  
 23546                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23547                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23548                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23549                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23550                                  ;	     segment.
 23551

 23553                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23554                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 23555                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 23556                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 23557                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.

 24149                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24150                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24151                                  ;
 24152                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24153                                  ;
 24154                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24155                                  ;	    AL = type
 24156                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24157                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24158                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24159                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24160                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24161                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24162                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24163                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24164                                  ;
 24165                                  ; Output:   None
 24166                                  ;
 24167                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24168                                  ;
 24169                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24170                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24171                                  
 24172                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24173 000016C3 57                      	push	di			;AN000;

 24178                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag

 24565                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24566                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24567                                  ;
 24568                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24569                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24570                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24571                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24572                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24573                                  ;
 24574                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24575                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24576                                  ;
 24577                                  ; Output:    None
 24578                                  ;
 24579                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 24580                                  ;
 24581                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 24582                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24583                                  
 24584                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24585                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 24586                                  
 24587                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 24588 00001872 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 24590 00001879 2E8026[1914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value

 24592 00001882 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 24593 00001884 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 24594                                  
 24595 00001886 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?

 24597                                  
 24598 0000188A 2E800E[1914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 24599                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 24600 00001890 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 24601                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 24602 00001891 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 24603 00001894 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24604 00001895 C3                      	retn

 25563                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25564                                  ;
 25565                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25566                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25567                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25568                                  
 25569                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25570                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25571                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25572                                  ;
 25573                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25574                                  
 25575                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25576                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25577                                  
 25578                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25579                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25580                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25581                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25582 00001C0B BD[2214]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25583                                  
 25584                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25585 00001C0E 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25586 00001C10 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25587                                  
 25588                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25589 00001C12 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25590 00001C14 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25591                                  
 25592 00001C16 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25593                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25594                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25595 00001C17 C3                      	retn
 25596                                  
 25597                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25598                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25599                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25600                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25601                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25602                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25603                                  
 25604                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25605                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25606 00001C18 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25607 00001C1A 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25608                                  
 25609 00001C1C 2E800E[1914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25610                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25611                                  
 25612                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25613                                  	; cf=0
 25614                                  	;retn
 25615                                  
 25616                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25617                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25618                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25619 00001C22 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25620                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25621                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25622 00001C23 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25623                                  
 25624                                  ;**************************************************************************
 25625                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25626                                  ;
 25627                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 25628                                  ;
 25629                                  ;  Input:
 25630                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 25631                                  ;
 25632                                  ;  Output:
 25633                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 25634                                  ;
 25635                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 25636                                  ;
 25637                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 25638                                  ;***************************************************************************
 25639                                  
 25640                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 25641 00001C24 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 25642 00001C25 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25643 00001C26 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25644                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 25645                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 25646                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25647 00001C27 2E8B36[1614]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 25648 00001C2C 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 25649 00001C2E 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 25650 00001C30 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25651 00001C31 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25652 00001C32 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25653 00001C33 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25654 00001C34 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 25655 00001C35 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 25656 00001C36 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 25657                                  	; si = 0 ; 14/08/2023
 25658                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 25659 00001C37 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 25660 00001C39 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 25661 00001C3C CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 25662                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 25663 00001C3E 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25664 00001C40 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25665 00001C42 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 25666 00001C43 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 25667 00001C44 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 25668 00001C45 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25669 00001C46 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 25670 00001C47 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 25671 00001C48 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25672 00001C49 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 25673                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 25674 00001C4B 2E8936[1414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 25675 00001C50 2E891E[1614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 25676                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 25677                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 25678                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25679                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25680 00001C55 2EC536[1414]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25681                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25682 00001C5A 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25683 00001C5D 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25684 00001C5F 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25685 00001C61 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25686 00001C63 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25687 00001C66 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25688 00001C68 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25689 00001C69 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25690                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25691 00001C6B 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25692 00001C6C 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25693                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25694 00001C6D EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25695                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25696                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25697                                  	; cf=0
 25698                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25699                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25700 00001C6F 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25701 00001C70 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25702 00001C71 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25703 00001C72 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26257                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26258                                  
 26259                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26260                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26261                                  
 26262                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26263                                  ;
 26264                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26265                                  ;
 26266                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26267                                  ;
 26268                                  ;   Modification log:
 26269                                  ;
 26270                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26271                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26272                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26273                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26274                                  ;
 26275                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26276                                  ;
 26277                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26278                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26279                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26280                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26281                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26282                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26283                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26284                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26285                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26286                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26287                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26288                                  ;
 26289                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26290                                  
 26291                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26292                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26293                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26294                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26295                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26296                                  
 26297                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26298                                  
 26299                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26300                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26301                                  
 26302                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26303                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26304                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26305                                  
 26306                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26307                                  ;
 26308                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26309                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26310                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26311                                  ;	           line.
 26312                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26313                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26314                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26315                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26316                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26317                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26318                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26319                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26320                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26321                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26322                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26323                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26324                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26325                                  ;	           for details).
 26326                                  
 26327                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26328                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26329                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26330                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26331                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26332                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26333                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26334                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26335                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26336                                  
 26337                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26338                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26339                                  
 26340                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26341                                  
 26342                                  %endif
 26343                                  
 26344                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26345

 26349                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26350                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 26351

 26353                                  
 26354 00001E56 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26355 00001E58 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26356 00001E5A 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26357 00001E5C 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26358 00001E60 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26359                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26360                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 26361                                  ;

 26363 00001E65 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26364 00001E67 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26365 00001E69 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)

 26391                                  
 26392                                  ; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26393                                  
 26394                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26395                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 26396                                  
 26397                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26398                                  ;
 26399                                  ; procedure : doconf
 26400                                  ;
 26401                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 26402                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 26403                                  ;
 26404                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26405                                  
 26406                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26407                                  doconf:
 26408 00001E89 0E                      	push	cs
 26409 00001E8A 1F                      	pop	ds
 26410                                  
 26411 00001E8B B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 26412                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 26413 00001E8E CD21                    	int	21h
 26414 00001E90 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 26415                                  
 26416                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26417                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26418                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 26419                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 26420                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26421                                  
 26422 00001E94 BA[0033]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 26423 00001E97 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 26424                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 26425 00001E9A F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26426 00001E9B CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26427 00001E9D 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 26428                                  
 26429                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26430                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26431                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 26432                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 26433                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 26434 00001E9F C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 26435 00001EA4 C3                      	retn
 26436                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 26437 00001EA5 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 26438 00001EA7 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26439 00001EA9 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26440                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 26441 00001EAB B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 26442 00001EAE CD21                    	int	21h
 26443 00001EB0 A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 26444                                  
 26445 00001EB3 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26446                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 26447 00001EB5 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 26448 00001EB8 CD21                    	int	21h
 26449                                  
 26450                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 26451                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26452 00001EBA 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 26453                                  
 26454 00001EBE A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 26455 00001EC1 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26456 00001EC4 E8D3F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26457 00001EC7 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26458                                  
 26459                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26460                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26461                                  ;;
 26462                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26463                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26464                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26465                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26466                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26467                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26468                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26469                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26470                                  ;;
 26471                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26472                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 26473                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 26474                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26475                                  
 26476 00001EC9 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 26477                                  	
 26478                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 26479                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 26480                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26481 00001ECC 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 26482 00001ED0 E8ECEC                  	call    TempCDS 
 26483                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26484                                  	; ds <> cs 
 26485 00001ED3 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 26486                                   
 26487 00001ED8 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 26488 00001EDA 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 26489                                  
 26490 00001EDC 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26491 00001EDE 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]

 26497

 26499

 26555                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26556                                  ;
 26557                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 26558                                  ;

 26564                                  multi_pass:
 26565 00001F1C 0E                      	push	cs

 26567

 26598                                  
 26599                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26600                                  %if 0
 26601                                  
 26602                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26603                                  
 26604                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26605                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26606                                  
 26607                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26608                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26609                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26610                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26611                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26612                                  
 26613                                          push    ax                      ;
 26614                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26615                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26616                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26617                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26618                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26619                                          pop     ax
 26620                                  ;
 26621                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26622                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26623                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26624                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26625                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26626                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26627                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26628                                  ;   spot.
 26629                                  ;
 26630                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26631                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26632                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26633                                  ;   retrieved.
 26634                                  ;
 26635                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26636                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26637                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26638                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26639                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26640                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26641                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26642                                  final:                                  ;
 26643                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26644                                  not_final:                              ;
 26645                                  ;endif
 26646                                  
 26647                                  %endif
 26648 00001F5B 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26649 00001F5D E87B10                  	call	getchr
 26650 00001F60 7314                    	jnc	short tryi

 26655 00001F67 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26656 00001F69 E90107                  	jmp	badop
 26657                                  	
 26658                                  coff:

 26660                                  	; ds = cs
 26661                                  	;push	cs
 26662                                  	;pop	ds

 26671                                  ; 11/12/2022

 26674                                  	;push	cs
 26675                                  	;pop	ds

 26678                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when

 26689 00001F76 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI

 26715                                  ;       but don't process them now.

 26739 00001FA2 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter

 26742                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG

 26748 00001FA7 EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.

 26751                                  %if 0
 26752                                  
 26753                                  multi_try_n:
 26754                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 26755                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26756                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26757                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26758                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26759                                  ;endif
 26760                                  
 26761                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26762                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26763                                  
 26764                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 26765                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 26766                                  	mov	bx,ax
 26767                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 26768                                  
 26769                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 26770                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 26771                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 26772                                  
 26773                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26774                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26775                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26776                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26777                                  
 26778                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26779                                  	mov	bx,1
 26780                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26781                                  
 26782                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26783                                  
 26784                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26785                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26786                                          int     21h
 26787                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26788                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26789                                          int     21h
 26790                                  
 26791                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26792                                  
 26793                                  %endif
 26794                                  
 26795                                  multi_pass_filter:
 26796 00001FA9 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?

 26800 00001FB3 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 26801 00001FB6 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 26802                                  
 26803                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 26804 00001FB8 FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count

 26811                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26812                                  ; buffer command
 26813                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26814                                  
 26815                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26816                                  ;									      *
 26817                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26818                                  ;									      *
 26819                                  ; input :								      *
 26820                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26821                                  ; output:								      *
 26822                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26823                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26824                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26825                                  ;									      *
 26826                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26827                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26828                                  ; logic:								      *
 26829                                  ; {									      *
 26830                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26831                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26832                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26833                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26834                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26835                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26836                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26837                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26838                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26839                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26840                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26841                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26842                                  ;	};								      *
 26843                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26844                                  ; };									      *
 26845                                  ;									      *
 26846                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26847                                  
 26848                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26849                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 26850                                  tryb:
 26851 00001FC2 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 26852 00001FC5 7557                    	jne	short tryc
 26853                                  
 26854                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26855                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26856                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26857                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26858                                  ;;endif
 26859                                  
 26860                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26861                                  	; 18/12/2022
 26862 00001FC7 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26863                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 26864 00001FC9 880E[BA1C]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 26865                                  
 26866 00001FCD BF[731C]                	mov	di,buf_parms
 26867                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 26868                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26869                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 26870                                  do7:
 26871 00001FD0 E87B06                  	call	sysinit_parse
 26872 00001FD3 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 26873                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26874                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 26875                                  	;;jmp	short sr7
 26876                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26877                                  ;sr7:
 26878                                  	;jmp	coff
 26879                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26880 00001FD5 E9F405                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 26881                                  if7:
 26882 00001FD8 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?
 26883 00001FDB 741A                    	je	short en7		;  then jmp to $endloop for semantic check
 26884                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x
 26885 00001FDD 813E[BE1C][B31C]        	cmp	word [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.SYNONYM_Ptr],switch_x
 26886                                  	;jne	short if11
 26887                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26888 00001FE3 74EB                    	je	short do7 ;je short en11
 26889                                  
 26890                                  ;	mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],1 ; set the flag M016
 26891                                  	;jmp	short en11 ; 31/12/2022
 26892                                  if11:
 26893                                  	;mov	ax,[rv_dword]
 26894 00001FE5 A1[C01C]                	mov	ax,[result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Picked_Val]
 26895 00001FE8 83F901                  	cmp	cx,1
 26896 00001FEB 7505                    	jne	short if13
 26897                                  
 26898 00001FED A3[B61C]                	mov	[p_buffers],ax
 26899                                  	;jmp	short en11
 26900                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26901 00001FF0 EBDE                    	jmp	short do7
 26902                                  if13:
 26903 00001FF2 A3[B81C]                	mov	[p_h_buffers],ax
 26904                                  en11:
 26905 00001FF5 EBD9                    	jmp	short do7
 26906                                  en7:
 26907 00001FF7 833E[B61C]63            	cmp	word [p_buffers],99
 26908 00001FFC 760B                    	jbe	short if18
 26909                                  
 26910                                  ;	cmp	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; M016
 26911                                  ;	jne	short if18
 26912                                  
 26913 00001FFE E87806                  	call	badparm_p
 26914 00002001 C706[B81C]0000          	mov	word [p_h_buffers],0
 26915 00002007 EB12                    	jmp	short sr7
 26916                                  if18:
 26917 00002009 A1[B61C]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.
 26918 0000200C A3[9702]                	mov	[buffers],ax	; now,let's set it really.
 26919                                  
 26920 0000200F A1[B81C]                	mov	ax,[p_h_buffers]
 26921 00002012 A3[9902]                	mov	[h_buffers],ax
 26922                                  
 26923                                  ;	mov	al,[p_buffer_slash_x]	; M016
 26924                                  ;	mov	[buffer_slash_x],al
 26925                                  
 26926 00002015 A1[2B03]                	mov	ax,[linecount]
 26927 00002018 A3[3503]                	mov	[buffer_linenum],ax ; save the line number for the future use.
 26928                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26929                                  	;jmp	short sr7
 26930                                  	; 04/01/2023
 26931                                  sr7:
 26932 0000201B E94EFF                  	jmp	coff

 26934                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26935                                  ; break command
 26936                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26937                                  
 26938                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26939                                  ;									    *
 26940                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26941                                  ;									    *
 26942                                  ; input :								    *
 26943                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26944                                  ; output:								    *
 26945                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26946                                  ;									    *
 26947                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26948                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 26949                                  ; logic:								    *
 26950                                  ; {									    *
 26951                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 26952                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 26953                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26954                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26955                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26956                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26957                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26958                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26959                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26960                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26961                                  ;	};								    *
 26962                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 26963                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 26964                                  ; };									    *
 26965                                  ;									    *
 26966                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26967

 27020                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27021                                  ; multitrack command
 27022                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27023                                  
 27024                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27025                                  ;									      *
 27026                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 27027                                  ;									      *
 27028                                  ; input :								      *
 27029                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27030                                  ; output:								      *
 27031                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 27032                                  ;									      *
 27033                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27034                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27035                                  ; logic:								      *
 27036                                  ; {									      *
 27037                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 27038                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27039                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27040                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27041                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27042                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 27043                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 27044                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 27045                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 27046                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 27047                                  ;	};								      *
 27048                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 27049                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *
 27050                                  ;									      *
 27051                                  ; };									      *
 27052                                  ;									      *
 27053                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27054                                  
 27055                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
