 27060                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27061                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27062                                  ;       call    query_user      ; query the user if config_cmd
 27063                                  ;       jc      short tryu	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27064                                  ;;endif
 27065 0000205C BF[C81D]                	mov	di,mtrk_parms
 27066 0000205F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27067                                  	; 04/01/2023
 27068                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27069                                  do31:
 27070 00002061 E8EA05                  	call	sysinit_parse
 27071 00002064 7303                    	jnc	short if31	; parse error
 27072                                  	;call	badparm_p	;  show message and end the search loop.
 27073                                  	;;jmp	short sr31
 27074                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27075                                  ;sr31:
 27076                                  	;jmp	coff
 27077                                  	; 04/01/2023
 27078 00002066 E96305                  	jmp	badparm_p_coff
 27079                                  if31:
 27080 00002069 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL	; end of line?
 27081 0000206C 7415                    	je	short en31	; then end the $endloop
 27082                                  
 27083                                  	;cmp	byte [result_val_itag],1
 27084 0000206E 803E[BD1C]01            	cmp	byte [result_val+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],1

 28283                                  ; };									      *
 28284                                  ;									      *
 28285                                  ;******************************************************************************

 28355                                  ; returns, and setparms as coded now can return with carry set. 
 28356                                  ;       jc	short trypbad

 28361                                  	;jc	short trypbad

 28364                                  trypbad:
 28365 000024B3 E9B701                  	jmp	badop
 28366                                  
 28367                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28368                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28369                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28370                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28371                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28372                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28373                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28374                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28375                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28376                                  
 28377                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28378                                  ;									  *
 28379                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28380                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28381                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28382                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28383                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28384                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28385                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28386                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28387                                  ; input :								  *
 28388                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28389                                  ; output:								  *
 28390                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28391                                  ;									  *
 28392                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28393                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28394                                  ; logic:								  *
 28395                                  ; {									  *
 28396                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28397                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28398                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28399                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28400                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28401                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28402                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28403                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28404                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28405                                  ;	     }								  *
 28406                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *

 28845                                  ;***********************************************************************
 28846                                  ;								       *
 28847                                  ; function: parse the option switches specified.		       *
 28848                                  ; note - this command is intended for the future use also.	       *
 28849                                  ; when we need to set system data flag,use this command.	       *
 28850                                  ;								       *
 28851                                  ; input :							       *
 28852                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.			       *
 28853                                  ; output:							       *
 28854                                  ;	p_swit_k set if /k option chosen.			       *

 29444                                  ;
 29445                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29446                                  ;
 29447                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29448                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29449                                  ;
 29450                                  ;	Output : none
 29451                                  ;
 29452                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29453                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29454                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29455                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29456                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29457                                  ;
 29458                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29459                                  
 29460                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29461                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29462                                  	; ds = cs
 29463 000026F3 A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29464                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 29465                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29466 000026F6 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29467 000026F9 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29468                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29469                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29470                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29471                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29472                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29473                                  	; ds = cs
 29474 000026FB 803E[731E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29475 00002700 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29476 00002702 A1[5A1E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29477                                  lim_set:
 29478                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29479                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29480                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29481                                  ;limx:
 29482                                  	;retn
 29483                                  	
 29484                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29485                                  
 29486                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29487                                  ;
 29488                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29489                                  ;
 29490                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29491                                  ;	Output : none
 29492                                  ;
 29493                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29494                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29495                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29496                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29497                                  ;
 29498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29499                                  
 29500                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29501                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29502 00002705 1E                      	push	ds
 29503 00002706 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29504 00002709 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29505 0000270B 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29506 0000270F 2E891E[771E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29507 00002714 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29508 00002716 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29509 00002718 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29510 0000271B 2EC606[761E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29511 00002721 1F                      	pop	ds
 29512                                  ;limx:
 29513 00002722 C3                      	retn
 29514                                  
 29515                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29516                                  ;
 29517                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29518                                  ;
 29519                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29520                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29521                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29522                                  ;
 29523                                  ;	Output : none
 29524                                  ;
 29525                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29526                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29527                                  ;
 29528                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29529                                  
 29530                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29531                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29532                                  	; ds = cs
 29533 00002723 803E[761E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29534                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29535                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29536                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29537 00002728 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29538                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29539 0000272A B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29540 0000272D 8826[761E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29541                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29542                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29543 00002731 1E                      	push	ds
 29544                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29545 00002732 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29546 00002734 2EA1[771E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29547 00002738 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29548 0000273B 1F                      	pop	ds
 29549                                  timx:
 29550 0000273C C3                      	retn
 29551                                  
 29552                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29553                                  ;
 29554                                  ; procedure : IsIt3Com?
 29555                                  ;
 29556                                  ;	Input : DevEntry = Seg:0 of device driver
 29557                                  ;	Output : Zero flag set if device name is 'PROTMAN$'
 29558                                  ;		 else Zero flag is reset
 29559                                  ;
 29560                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29561                                  
 29562                                  IsIt3Com:
 29563                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29564                                  	; ds = cs
 29565 0000273D 1E                      	push	ds
 29566 0000273E 06                      	push	es
 29567 0000273F 56                      	push	si
 29568                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29569 00002740 C536[5C1E]              	lds	si,[DevEntry]
 29570                                  	;lds	si,[cs:DevEntry]	; ptr to device header
 29571 00002744 83C60A                  	add	si,SYSDEV.NAME ; 10 	; ptr device name
 29572 00002747 0E                      	push	cs
 29573 00002748 07                      	pop	es
 29574 00002749 BF[791E]                	mov	di,ThreeComName
 29575 0000274C B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; name length
 29576 0000274F F3A6                    	rep	cmpsb
 29577 00002751 5E                      	pop	si
 29578 00002752 07                      	pop	es
 29579 00002753 1F                      	pop	ds
 29580 00002754 C3                      	retn

 29589 0000275A 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx
 29590 0000275C 2E8B1E[A302]            	mov	bx,[cs:ALLOCLIM]
 29591                                  	;mov	[2],bx
 29592 00002761 891E0200                	mov	[PDB.BLOCK_LEN],bx
 29593 00002765 1F                      	pop	ds
 29594 00002766 C3                      	retn

 29600                                  ; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29601                                  
 29602                                  %if 0
 29603                                  
 29604                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 29605                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 29606                                  
 29607                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29608                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 29609                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 29610                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29611                                  
 29612                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29613                                  ;
 29614                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29615                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29616                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29617                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29618                                  ;
 29619                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29620                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29621                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29622                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29623                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29624                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29625                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29626                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29627                                  ; available during the load.
 29628                                  ;
 29629                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29630                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29631                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29632                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29633                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29634                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29635                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29636                                  ;
 29637                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29638                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29639                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29640                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29641                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29642                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29643                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29644                                  ;
 29645                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29646                                  
 29647                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29648                                  
 29649                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29650                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29651                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29652                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29653                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29654                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29655                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29656                                  
 29657                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29658                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29659                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29660                                  
 29661                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29662                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29663                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29664                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29665                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29666                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29667                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29668                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29669                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29670                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29671                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29672                                  
 29673                                  InitVar:
 29674                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29675                                  	push	ax
 29676                                  	push	cx
 29677                                  	push	di
 29678                                  	push	es
 29679                                  
 29680                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29681                                  	push	cs
 29682                                  	pop	es
 29683                                  
 29684                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29685                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29686                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29687                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29688                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29689                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29690                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29691                                  
 29692                                  	cld
 29693                                  
 29694                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29695                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29696                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29697                                  
 29698                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29699                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29700                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29701                                  
 29702                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29703                                  
 29704                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29705                                  	pop	es
 29706                                  	pop	di
 29707                                  	pop	cx
 29708                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29709                                  
 29710                                  	retn
 29711                                  
 29712                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29713                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29714                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29715                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29716                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29717                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29718                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29719                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29720                                  
 29721                                  FixMem:
 29722                                  	push	ax
 29723                                  	push	bx
 29724                                  	push	cx
 29725                                  	push	dx
 29726                                  	push	es
 29727                                  
 29728                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29729                                  
 29730                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29731                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29732                                  
 29733                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29734                                  
 29735                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29736                                  
 29737                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29738                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29739                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29740                                  
 29741                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29742                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29743                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29744                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29745                                  
 29746                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29747                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29748                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29749                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29750                                  
 29751                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29752                                  
 29753                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29754                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29755                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29756                                  
 29757                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29758                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29759                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29760                                  	inc	bx
 29761                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29762                                  
 29763                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29764                                  
 29765                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29766                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29767                                  
 29768                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29769                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29770                                  	inc	bx
 29771                                  	mov	es,bx
 29772                                  
 29773                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29774                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29775                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29776                                  fmX:	
 29777                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29778                                  
 29779                                  	pop	es
 29780                                  	pop	dx
 29781                                  	pop	cx
 29782                                  	pop	bx
 29783                                  	pop	ax
 29784                                  
 29785                                  	retn
 29786                                  
 29787                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29788                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29789                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29790                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29791                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29792                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29793                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29794                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29795                                  
 29796                                  fm_link:
 29797                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29798                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29799                                  
 29800                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29801                                  	;
 29802                                  	;push	es
 29803                                  	;push	cs
 29804                                  	;pop	es
 29805                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29806                                  	;pop	es
 29807                                  	
 29808                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29809                                  
 29810                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29811                                  	mov	bx,1
 29812                                  	int	21h
 29813                                  	retn
 29814                                  
 29815                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29816                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29817                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29818                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29819                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29820                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29821                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29822                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29823                                  
 29824                                  fm_unlink:
 29825                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29826                                  	
 29827                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29828                                  	;
 29829                                  	;push	ds
 29830                                  	;push	cs
 29831                                  	;pop	ds
 29832                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29833                                  	;pop	ds
 29834                                  	
 29835                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29836                                  
 29837                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29838                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29839                                  	retn
 29840                                  
 29841                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29842                                  
 29843                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29844                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29845                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29846                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29847                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29848                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29849                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29850                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29851                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29852                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29853                                  ;
 29854                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29855                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29856                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29857                                  ;
 29858                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29859                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29860                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29861                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29862                                  ;
 29863                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29864                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29865                                  ;
 29866                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29867                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29868                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29869                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29870                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29871                                  ;     lh
 29872                                  ;     /l
 29873                                  ;     1
 29874                                  ;     1000
 29875                                  ;     2
 29876                                  ;     print
 29877                                  ;     /d
 29878                                  ;     :lpt2
 29879                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29880                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29881                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29882                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29883                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29884                                  ; for:
 29885                                  ;    Each /L
 29886                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29887                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29888                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29889                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29890                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29891                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29892                                  
 29893                                  ParseVar:
 29894                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29895                                  	push	di
 29896                                  	push	ds
 29897                                  	push	es
 29898                                  
 29899                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29900                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29901                                  	cld
 29902                                  
 29903                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29904                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29905                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29906                                  
 29907                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29908                                  	call	isWhite
 29909                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29910                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29911                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29912                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29913                                  
 29914                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29915                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29916                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29917                                  
 29918                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29919                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29920                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29921                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29922                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29923                                  	jne	short pv30
 29924                                  
 29925                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29926                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29927                                  
 29928                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29929                                  	;
 29930                                  	;push	es
 29931                                  	;push	cs
 29932                                  	;pop	es
 29933                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29934                                  	;pop	es
 29935                                  
 29936                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29937                                  
 29938                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29939                                  
 29940                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29941                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29942                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29943                                  
 29944                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29945                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29946                                  
 29947                                  	call	parseL
 29948                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29949                                  
 29950                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29951                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29952                                  
 29953                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29954                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29955                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29956                                  	dec	si
 29957                                  	stc
 29958                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29959                                  	pop	es
 29960                                  	pop	ds
 29961                                  	pop	di
 29962                                  	retn
 29963                                  
 29964                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29965                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29966                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29967                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29968                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29969                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29970                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29971                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29972                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29973                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29974                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29975                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29976                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29977                                  
 29978                                  parseL:
 29979                                  	lodsb
 29980                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29981                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29982                                  
 29983                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29984                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29985                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29986                                  
 29987                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29988                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29989                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29990                                  
 29991                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29992                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29993                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29994                                  
 29995                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29996                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29997                                  
 29998                                  	lodsb
 29999                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30000                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30001                                  
 30002                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30003                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30004                                  
 30005                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30006                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30007                                  
 30008                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30009                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30010                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30011                                  
 30012                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30013                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30014                                  
 30015                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30016                                  
 30017                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30018                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30019                                  
 30020                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30021                                  
 30022                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30023                                  
 30024                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30025                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30026                                  
 30027                                  	lodsb
 30028                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30029                                  	je	short pl10	;
 30030                                  
 30031                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30032                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30033                                  
 30034                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30035                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30036                                  
 30037                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30038                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30039                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30040                                  plE1:	
 30041                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30042                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30043                                  	dec	si
 30044                                  	stc
 30045                                  	retn
 30046                                  
 30047                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 30048                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 30049                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30050                                  	; cf=1
 30051                                  	;stc
 30052                                  	retn
 30053                                  plSwX:	
 30054                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 30055                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 30056                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 30057                                  	; cf=0
 30058                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 30059                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 30060                                  
 30061                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30062                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 30063                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30064                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30065                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30066                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30067                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 30068                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30069                                  
 30070                                  ;incArgc:
 30071                                  	;push	ax
 30072                                  
 30073                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 30074                                  
 30075                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 30076                                  
 30077                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 30078                                  
 30079                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 30080                                  
 30081                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 30082                                  
 30083                                  	;pop	ax
 30084                                  	;retn
 30085                                  
 30086                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30087                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30088                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30089                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30090                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30091                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30092                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30093                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30094                                  
 30095                                  isEOL:
 30096                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 30097                                  	je	short ieX
 30098                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 30099                                  	je	short ieX
 30100                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 30101                                  ieX:	
 30102                                  	retn
 30103                                  
 30104                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30105                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 30106                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30107                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30108                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 30109                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30110                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30111                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30112                                  
 30113                                  isWhite:
 30114                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 30115                                  	je	short iwX
 30116                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 30117                                  	je	short iwX
 30118                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 30119                                  iwX:	
 30120                                  	retn
 30121                                  
 30122                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30123                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 30124                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30125                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 30126                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30127                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30128                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30129                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30130                                  
 30131                                  unMarkUMB:
 30132                                  	push	ax
 30133                                  	push	bx
 30134                                  	push	di
 30135                                  	push	es
 30136                                  
 30137                                  	push	cs
 30138                                  	pop	es
 30139                                  
 30140                                  	xor	ah,ah
 30141                                  	mov	bx,ax
 30142                                  
 30143                                  	; 19/04/2019
 30144                                  	
 30145                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 30146                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 30147                                  
 30148                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 30149                                  	jne	short umu10
 30150                                  
 30151                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 30152                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 30153                                  umu10:	
 30154                                  	pop	es
 30155                                  	pop	di
 30156                                  	pop	bx
 30157                                  	pop	ax
 30158                                  	retn
 30159                                  
 30160                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30161                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 30162                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 30163                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 30164                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 30165                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30166                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 30167                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30168                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 30169                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30170                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30171                                  
 30172                                  stowUMB:
 30173                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 30174                                  	jb	short su10
 30175                                  	stc
 30176                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 30177                                  su10:	
 30178                                  	push	bx
 30179                                  	push	di
 30180                                  	push	si
 30181                                  	push	ds
 30182                                  	push	es
 30183                                  	push	cs
 30184                                  	pop	es
 30185                                  	push	cs
 30186                                  	pop	ds
 30187                                  	
 30188                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 30189                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 30190                                  	jne	short su20
 30191                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 30192                                  su20:	
 30193                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 30194                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 30195                                  
 30196                                  	mov	bl,al
 30197                                  	xor	bh,bh
 30198                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 30199                                  
 30200                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 30201                                  
 30202                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 30203                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 30204                                  
 30205                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 30206                                  su30:	
 30207                                  	pop	es
 30208                                  	pop	ds
 30209                                  	pop	si
 30210                                  	pop	di
 30211                                  	pop	bx
 30212                                  	retn
 30213                                  
 30214                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30215                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 30216                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30217                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 30218                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30219                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30220                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30221                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30222                                  
 30223                                  ; 13/05/2019
 30224                                  
 30225                                  stowSiz:
 30226                                  	push	bx
 30227                                  	;push	di ; ?
 30228                                  	push	es
 30229                                  
 30230                                  	push	cs
 30231                                  	pop	es	
 30232                                  
 30233                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 30234                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 30235                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 30236                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 30237                                  	
 30238                                  	pop	es
 30239                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 30240                                  	pop	bx
 30241                                  
 30242                                  	retn
 30243                                  
 30244                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30245                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 30246                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 30247                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 30248                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 30249                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30250                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 30251                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 30252                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 30253                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 30254                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30255                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30256                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30257                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30258                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30259                                  
 30260                                  gnradix:
 30261                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 30262                                  
 30263                                  toDigit:
 30264                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 30265                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 30266                                  
 30267                                  toDigit_hex:
 30268                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 30269                                  	jb	short td10
 30270                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 30271                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 30272                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 30273                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30274                                  	retn
 30275                                  td10:	
 30276                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 30277                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 30278                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 30279                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 30280                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 30281                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30282                                  	retn
 30283                                  toDigit_dec:
 30284                                  td20:	
 30285                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 30286                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 30287                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 30288                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 30289                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 30290                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 30291                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 30292                                  	retn
 30293                                  tdE:	
 30294                                  	stc
 30295                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 30296                                  	retn
 30297                                  
 30298                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30299                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 30300                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30301                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 30302                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 30303                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 30304                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 30305                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30306                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 30307                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 30308                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 30309                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30310                                  
 30311                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30312                                  
 30313                                  GetXNum:
 30314                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 30315                                  	push	bx
 30316                                  	push	cx
 30317                                  	push	ds
 30318                                  
 30319                                  	cld
 30320                                  	xor	ax,ax
 30321                                  	xor	bx,bx
 30322                                  	xor	cx,cx
 30323                                  	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 30324                                  
 30325                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 30326                                  
 30327                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 30328                                  	;call	toDigit
 30329                                  	call	toDigit_dec
 30330                                  	jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 30331                                  
 30332                                  	or	cl,cl
 30333                                  	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 30334                                  	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 30335                                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 30336                                  	je	short gxn10
 30337                                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 30338                                  	jne	short gxn20
 30339                                  
 30340                                  gxn10:	
 30341                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 30342                                  	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 30343                                  	inc	si
 30344                                  
 30345                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30346                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 30347                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 30348                                  ;        BX    = 0
 30349                                  ;        CH    = 0
 30350                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 30351                                  
 30352                                  gxn20:	
 30353                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 30354                                  	inc	si
 30355                                  
 30356                                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 30357                                  	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 30358                                  
 30359                                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 30360                                  	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 30361                                  
 30362                                  	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 30363                                  	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 30364                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 30365                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 30366                                  	jnc	short gxn20
 30367                                  gxnE:	
 30368                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 30369                                  	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 30370                                  gxnQ:	
 30371                                  	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 30372                                  	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 30373                                  gxnX:	
 30374                                  	pop	ds
 30375                                  	pop	cx
 30376                                  	pop	bx
 30377                                  	retn
 30378                                  
 30379                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30380                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 30381                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30382                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 30383                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 30384                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 30385                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30386                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30387                                  
 30388                                  mul32:
 30389                                  	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30390                                  	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30391                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30392                                  	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 30393                                  
 30394                                  	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 30395                                  	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30396                                  
 30397                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30398                                  	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 30399                                  	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30400                                  	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 30401                                  	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 30402                                  	retn
 30403                                  m32E:	
 30404                                  	pop	ax
 30405                                  	retn
 30406                                  
 30407                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30408                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 30409                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30410                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 30411                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 30412                                  ; ERROR:   None
 30413                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 30414                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30415                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 30416                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 30417                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30418                                  
 30419                                  toPara:
 30420                                  	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 30421                                  
 30422                                  	mov	cl,4		;
 30423                                  	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 30424                                  	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 30425                                  	mov	cl,12
 30426                                  	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 30427                                  	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 30428                                  
 30429                                  	pop	cx
 30430                                  	retn
 30431                                  
 30432                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30433                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 30434                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30435                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 30436                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 30437                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 30438                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 30439                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30440                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 30441                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 30442                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 30443                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 30444                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30445                                  
 30446                                  UmbHead:
 30447                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 30448                                  
 30449                                  	;push	si ; ?
 30450                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 30451                                  	;push	es
 30452                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 30453                                  
 30454                                  	; 09/04/2019
 30455                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 30456                                  
 30457                                  	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 30458                                  	int	21h
 30459                                  
 30460                                  	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 30461                                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 30462                                  	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 30463                                  
 30464                                  	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 30465                                  	;jmp	short uhX
 30466                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30467                                  	retn
 30468                                  uhE:	
 30469                                  	stc
 30470                                  uhX:	
 30471                                  	;pop	bx ; *
 30472                                  	;pop	es
 30473                                  	;pop	ds ; ?
 30474                                  	;pop	si ; ?
 30475                                  	retn
 30476                                  
 30477                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
